story:
The Cause

Growing roses out of concrete

The Made in Goma Project by DRC ApeParel (www.DRCApeParel.com) aims to foster the passion for creative entrepreneurship in apparel production by educating youth at the Yole!Africa (www.YoleAfrica.org) community center on the skills needed to start-up and run a sustainable screen printing production business. An emphasis will be focused on collaborating and building strategic partnerships in the local community as well as abroad with other visual artists, seamstresses, accessory and apparel designers, to produce a lifestyle business model around products that will be "Made in Goma."
Goma, located in the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, is currently a city affected by one the deadliest conflicts since World War II, with over 6 million dead and millions more people forcefully displaced. In this context, civil services (including schools) are often shut down, leaving young people without education, and with few choices. Yole!Africa, a cultural center founded by acclaimed Congolese filmmaker and activist Petna Ndaliko and located in Goma, DRCongo provides youth the space, skills, and alternative education necessary to thrive despite the conflict in the region. 

We are not doing anything new, just doing what we feel is right. The youth, whom we like to call the "Divine Righteous Children" or "DRChildren" are the motivation behind everything we do at DRC ApeParel. The DRChildren are the future and the future is happening now. Together, you, us, the DRChildren and our strategic partners can cultivate even more beautiful roses coming out of a worn-torn concrete of east part of DRCongo. 

The project, a multi-stop international tour, will teach local Goma youth the art of screen printing, create an apparel production collaboration with local Goma artisans and result in a full-length documentary capturing the project’s year-long development, where the youth-made and local-artisan collaboration products will be marketed and sold. The tour will also serve the purpose of being the marketing and branding engine to spread the word far and wide of the products being "Made in Goma", to create a demand and ensure the sustainability of the project. 

With your extra-extra support, after reaching our initial goal of equipping a professional compact screen print studio at Yole!Africa, we will unlock our stretch goals, which will allow us to implement the full scale business model that which will put project on a great position to be able to sustain itself in Goma for years to come.

The opportunities are wide open for you to be involved in making this happen with us. Your contribution to this project both financially and with your heart, believing in our mission and purpose, will give us the tools we need to make this a reality. Jump on board and be a part of the dopeness that's being "Made in Goma". Global Citizens Unite!


The Story

A Creative Director with a creative vision

For two decades filmmaker, creative director and first generation Congolese-American, Eric Ndelo has made it his life’s mission to spread international awareness of the Beauty and the Crisis in the Congo.

After seeing apparel design as a more practical and efficient outlet for bringing his native culture to the forefront, Ndelo put filmmaking aside and started DRC ApeParel, Ltd. (www.DRCApeParel.com), an African streetwear and lifestyle brand, born in the U.S.A. and inspired by the love, art, and heritage of the Congo and the African Diaspora.

Now, Ndelo is returning to his filmmaking roots as DRC ApeParel travels throughout the US and abroad, capturing the global streetwear lifestyle and his company’s year-long effort to establish itself in the Congo as a resource partner for entrepreneurial growth amongst the youth and artisans. 

With Yole!Africa celebrating its 15 year anniversary this year, the organization has set the foundation and paved a way for the youth to alternatively and creatively reshape their future. This ground work has tilled the soil in Goma, making it easier for us at DRC ApeParel to plant our roots and be a part of Yole's growing movement of empowering the youth, by contributing our passion for entrepreneurship, apparel production and international cross-cultural exchange.

This July, Ndelo and associates will travel to Goma, DRCongo for YOLE!AFRICA's 10th Annual Salaam Kivu International Film Festival (SKIFF) (www.salaamkivu.org) where he, for the second time, will lead a screen printing workshop, along with some of the outstanding youth that excelled in the previous year's workshop. We will teach additional skills this year by enhancing the curriculum to include: artwork design, color separation, film output, screen making, entrepreneurship, collaboration, marketing and branding. 


The Opportunity

Made In Goma Project Blueprint -- An Inside Look

Last year’s workshop, which culminated in a successful fashion show co-produced by the youth debuting their t-shirt concepts and showcasing their styling skills using clothing by DRC ApeParel. It also printed the original MADE IN GOMA design on over 100 pieces ranging for pants to hoodies to t-shirts. The youth, as well as other members of the community came to the workshop with whatever piece of clothing they could find in order to get designs printed on them. The word spread and the workshop really had a very positive impact with the youth at YOLE!AFRICA and the greater community. The youth and still stay in connect and they are ready to continue where we left off. 

With your help, the Made in Goma campaign will give DRC ApeParel the wonderful opportunity to reconnect with the youth at YOLE!AFRICA and take what we previously started to the next level. What's this next level you're taking about, you may ask? Well the answer is quite simple. By equipping a professional compact screen printing production studio at the Yole!Africa Community Center. Last year we accomplished great things with just one small screen printing press, a few screens and a limited supply of ink. All of which were left in Goma for the youth to continue to bring their creative visions to life. Over time the inks ran out and new screens were needed, which brought everything to a halt. So just imagine what they could continue to accomplish with an improved production capacity, including equipment such as; a production level screen printing press, a screen exposure machine, a flash dryer, a solar generator, large supplies of ink, t-shirts, a pressure washer and much more. With this professional setup, along with adequate amount of supplies, the youth can produce screen printed apparel at the Yole!Africa and sell locally and on the international market. With a continued partnership with DRC ApeParel, the studio will be able implement a business model that will be able to sustain itself, thus ensuring the Made in Goma Project will be able to reach maximum impact for years to come. 

In addition to stimulating the passion and skills entrepreneurship with the youth, DRC will lead by example in collaborating with Kivu Nuru (www.kivunuru.com), an art house that seeks to provide space for aspiring young talents in eastern Congo to create strategic cut & sew apparel and accessory production partnerships with local Goma artisans. The aim of the workshop and collaboration is to create a sustainable model for economic growth through a continued partnership with DRC ApeParel.

The next stop after SKIFF, will be a flight from Goma to Kinshasa, the capital of DRCongo to participate in Kinshasa Fashion Week, where we will feature a Made in Goma Collection produced by the youth, a DRC ApeParel Collection and products created by the local Goma artisans. The tour will continue in the United States, with a vending opportunities in Brooklyn in August, Atlanta in early September, branded events in DC and Philadelphia in mid to late September, and closing out during Congo Week (October) in Charlotte, NC. DRC ApeParel will be showcasing and raising awareness of the Made in Goma Project, engaging the cross-cultural exchange and retailing the youth-made and local-artisan products at each stop on the tour.


The Need

Make an Impact Through Giving

Proceeds will be reinvested back into Goma for new products geared for the upcoming season. Thus continuing the business relationships established; not just moving on and leaving them to fend for themselves, but to grow with them and expand the product assortments and customer reach around the globe.

Partnering with the Made in Goma project, your contribution will go towards the following resources:


  • Studio Construction: Money to equip a professional compact screen print studio at Yole!Africa Community Center, purchase production materials and shipping costs to Goma

  • Working Capital for Collaboration: Money to establish cut & sew apparel and accessory production partnerships with the artisans of Kivu Nuru and shipping of products to the United States

  • Tour Expenses: Money for production fees, venue bookings, vending fees, travel and promotion/marketing of tour dates/events

  • Film Production: Money to film, edit, package and market the Made in Goma Project documentary DVD

Stretch Goals


The Rewards

Thank you for your support and partnership!

All information pertaining to the perks such as size and color will be gathered in an email sent to you after the end of the campaign on June 28, 2015.

Below you will find the images of the various perks you can receive based on your level of support. Buy a tee for a friend, a tote for your mother, a tank top to show off your muscles for the summer or even a hoodie to keep warm in the winter. Either way, GET YOURS!!


The Risks

Preparing for the challenges

Many of you may be familiar with the challenges that come with doing business overseas: increasing international shipping costs, unpredictable political stability, challenging telecommunications, and poor infrastructure, just to name a few. We are determined to make the screen printing studio and strategic partnerships succeed, be profitable and create a sustainable economic model, while continuing to provide resources to and collaborate with the youth and the artisans in Goma.

We realize that power flows from the people and the more people we have on board the more impactful we can be. We, with your help, will continue in the overall mission of empowering the Congolese through apparel entrepreneurship utilizing the creative and intellectual talents they already posses.



Spread the Word - #MadeInGoma

If you can't help us financially with this campaign there are other ways you can contribute.  We would really appreciate if you would help us get the word out about this campaign.  Tell your friends about us using Facebook, Twitter or other social media platform, including #MadeInGoma.  You may also use the Share tools on this page.

Frequently Asked Questions

Questions about Made in Goma...we have the answers


How will you determine International shipping costs between Goma to the US?

International shipping from Goma to the USA is expensive. There is a DHL is located in the heart of Goma, in addition to a FedEx a few hours across the border in Kigali, Rwanda. An alternative to cutting costs is for the DRC team to bring additional luggage via the flight back to the United States. Shipping of the screen printing equipment from the United States to Goma will be handled by the manufacturers.

Do you have a reliable and trusted partner to manage apparel production on the ground in Goma?

The owner of Kivu Nuru works directly with the local artisans and retails their pieces in her store via consignment  business model. She will be our direct partner on the ground making sure all runs smoothly with the production process.

Do you have any trained and skilled operators of the screen printing equipment?

Last year, there were 4 outstanding students that became my apprentices and continued to teach and practice after my return to the States. These individuals are skilled operators and trainers who work in the screen print studio.

Who will manage the screen print studio after DRC ApeParel's departure?

Yole!Africa will manage and oversee the screen print studio. They house the studio in their community center and monitor its use. They will act as the sale representatives spreading the word of the services offered at their center to other businesses and non-government organizations (NGO's).

How will you keep stock and re-order screen print production supplies such as inks, t-shirts and screens?

With the sustainability model built around the production coming out of the studio it will be able to make its own re-orders and manage its inventory with funds generated from sales of t-shirts and screen print jobs.

How will you secure accounts with boutiques?

We will do a photoshoot in Goma, create a lookbook and line sheets to present to boutiques in the cities we travel to on the tour and beyond using a commission-based sales team to secure accounts with places that love and believe in what we do.

How will you promote the tour and reach customers in the global market?

We will use strategic Guerilla marketing tactics to form street teams and throughout social media channels. We will send out press releases to the traditional and digital media outlets such as newspapers, magazines and blogs to promote the tour and the purpose. We will use search engine marketing techniques to reach the global customer base as well our influential connections to increase our presence with foreign media and blogs.

Having a dedicated cameraman to travel with us to film the entire experience?

Reaching our goals will allow us to have a professional cameraman on to capture those key moments of creation and excitement as the DRC team embarks on this Made in Goma journey.

Thank You

Our work is made possible thanks to you

Thank you for taking the time to learn about our Made In Goma Project, Indiegogo campaign. When you give to this campaign, you become a part of our collective network. We need your voice. We must stand together to carry out this mission of a sustainable economic environment for Goma. Congo Strong! Global Citizens Unite!
story_txt:
The Cause
Growing roses out of concreteThe Made in Goma Project by DRC ApeParel (www.DRCApeParel.com) aims to foster the passion for creative entrepreneurship in apparel production by educating youth at the Yole!Africa (www.YoleAfrica.org) community center on the skills needed to start-up and run a sustainable screen printing production business. An emphasis will be focused on collaborating and building strategic partnerships in the local community as well as abroad with other visual artists, seamstresses, accessory and apparel designers, to produce a lifestyle business model around products that will be "Made in Goma."

Goma, located in the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, is currently a city affected by one the deadliest conflicts since World War II, with over 6 million dead and millions more people forcefully displaced. In this context, civil services (including schools) are often shut down, leaving young people without education, and with few choices. Yole!Africa, a cultural center founded by acclaimed Congolese filmmaker and activist Petna Ndaliko and located in Goma, DRCongo provides youth the space, skills, and alternative education necessary to thrive despite the conflict in the region. 
We are not doing anything new, just doing what we feel is right. The youth, whom we like to call the "Divine Righteous Children" or "DRChildren" are the motivation behind everything we do at DRC ApeParel. The DRChildren are the future and the future is happening now. Together, you, us, the DRChildren and our strategic partners can cultivate even more beautiful roses coming out of a worn-torn concrete of east part of DRCongo. The project, a multi-stop international tour, will teach local Goma youth the art of screen printing, create an apparel production collaboration with local Goma artisans and result in a full-length documentary capturing the project’s year-long development, where the youth-made and local-artisan collaboration products will be marketed and sold. The tour will also serve the purpose of being the marketing and branding engine to spread the word far and wide of the products being "Made in Goma", to create a demand and ensure the sustainability of the project. 
With your extra-extra support, after reaching our initial goal of equipping a professional compact screen print studio at Yole!Africa, we will unlock our stretch goals, which will allow us to implement the full scale business model that which will put project on a great position to be able to sustain itself in Goma for years to come.The opportunities are wide open for you to be involved in making this happen with us. Your contribution to this project both financially and with your heart, believing in our mission and purpose, will give us the tools we need to make this a reality. Jump on board and be a part of the dopeness that's being "Made in Goma". Global Citizens Unite!The Story 
A Creative Director with a creative vision
For two decades filmmaker, creative director and first generation Congolese-American, Eric Ndelo has made it his life’s mission to spread international awareness of the Beauty and the Crisis in the Congo.
After seeing apparel design as a more practical and efficient outlet for bringing his native culture to the forefront, Ndelo put filmmaking aside and started DRC ApeParel, Ltd. (www.DRCApeParel.com), an African streetwear and lifestyle brand, born in the U.S.A. and inspired by the love, art, and heritage of the Congo and the African Diaspora.
Now, Ndelo is returning to his filmmaking roots as DRC ApeParel travels throughout the US and abroad, capturing the global streetwear lifestyle and his company’s year-long effort to establish itself in the Congo as a resource partner for entrepreneurial growth amongst the youth and artisans. With Yole!Africa celebrating its 15 year anniversary this year, the organization has set the foundation and paved a way for the youth to alternatively and creatively reshape their future. This ground work has tilled the soil in Goma, making it easier for us at DRC ApeParel to plant our roots and be a part of Yole's growing movement of empowering the youth, by contributing our passion for entrepreneurship, apparel production and international cross-cultural exchange.This July, Ndelo and associates will travel to Goma, DRCongo for YOLE!AFRICA's 10th Annual Salaam Kivu International Film Festival (SKIFF) (www.salaamkivu.org) where he, for the second time, will lead a screen printing workshop, along with some of the outstanding youth that excelled in the previous year's workshop. We will teach additional skills this year by enhancing the curriculum to include: artwork design, color separation, film output, screen making, entrepreneurship, collaboration, marketing and branding. 
The Opportunity
Made In Goma Project Blueprint -- An Inside Look 
Last year’s workshop, which culminated in a successful fashion show co-produced by the youth debuting their t-shirt concepts and showcasing their styling skills using clothing by DRC ApeParel. It also printed the original MADE IN GOMA design on over 100 pieces ranging for pants to hoodies to t-shirts. The youth, as well as other members of the community came to the workshop with whatever piece of clothing they could find in order to get designs printed on them. The word spread and the workshop really had a very positive impact with the youth at YOLE!AFRICA and the greater community. The youth and still stay in connect and they are ready to continue where we left off. 
With your help, the Made in Goma campaign will give DRC ApeParel the wonderful opportunity to reconnect with the youth at YOLE!AFRICA and take what we previously started to the next level. What's this next level you're taking about, you may ask? Well the answer is quite simple. By equipping a professional compact screen printing production studio at the Yole!Africa Community Center. Last year we accomplished great things with just one small screen printing press, a few screens and a limited supply of ink. All of which were left in Goma for the youth to continue to bring their creative visions to life. Over time the inks ran out and new screens were needed, which brought everything to a halt. So just imagine what they could continue to accomplish with an improved production capacity, including equipment such as; a production level screen printing press, a screen exposure machine, a flash dryer, a solar generator, large supplies of ink, t-shirts, a pressure washer and much more. With this professional setup, along with adequate amount of supplies, the youth can produce screen printed apparel at the Yole!Africa and sell locally and on the international market. With a continued partnership with DRC ApeParel, the studio will be able implement a business model that will be able to sustain itself, thus ensuring the Made in Goma Project will be able to reach maximum impact for years to come. In addition to stimulating the passion and skills entrepreneurship with the youth, DRC will lead by example in collaborating with Kivu Nuru (www.kivunuru.com), an art house that seeks to provide space for aspiring young talents in eastern Congo to create strategic cut & sew apparel and accessory production partnerships with local Goma artisans. The aim of the workshop and collaboration is to create a sustainable model for economic growth through a continued partnership with DRC ApeParel.The next stop after SKIFF, will be a flight from Goma to Kinshasa, the capital of DRCongo to participate in Kinshasa Fashion Week, where we will feature a Made in Goma Collection produced by the youth, a DRC ApeParel Collection and products created by the local Goma artisans. The tour will continue in the United States, with a vending opportunities in Brooklyn in August, Atlanta in early September, branded events in DC and Philadelphia in mid to late September, and closing out during Congo Week (October) in Charlotte, NC. DRC ApeParel will be showcasing and raising awareness of the Made in Goma Project, engaging the cross-cultural exchange and retailing the youth-made and local-artisan products at each stop on the tour.The Need 
Make an Impact Through Giving
Proceeds will be reinvested back into Goma for new products geared for the upcoming season. Thus continuing the business relationships established; not just moving on and leaving them to fend for themselves, but to grow with them and expand the product assortments and customer reach around the globe.
Partnering with the Made in Goma project, your contribution will go towards the following resources:


Studio Construction: Money to equip a professional compact screen print studio at Yole!Africa Community Center, purchase production materials and shipping costs to Goma
Working Capital for Collaboration: Money to establish cut & sew apparel and accessory production partnerships with the artisans of Kivu Nuru and shipping of products to the United States
Tour Expenses: Money for production fees, venue bookings, vending fees, travel and promotion/marketing of tour dates/events
Film Production: Money to film, edit, package and market the Made in Goma Project documentary DVD

Stretch GoalsThe Rewards 
Thank you for your support and partnership!All information pertaining to the perks such as size and color will be gathered in an email sent to you after the end of the campaign on June 28, 2015.Below you will find the images of the various perks you can receive based on your level of support. Buy a tee for a friend, a tote for your mother, a tank top to show off your muscles for the summer or even a hoodie to keep warm in the winter. Either way, GET YOURS!!

The Risks
Preparing for the challengesMany of you may be familiar with the challenges that come with doing business overseas: increasing international shipping costs, unpredictable political stability, challenging telecommunications, and poor infrastructure, just to name a few. We are determined to make the screen printing studio and strategic partnerships succeed, be profitable and create a sustainable economic model, while continuing to provide resources to and collaborate with the youth and the artisans in Goma.
We realize that power flows from the people and the more people we have on board the more impactful we can be. story:
What is this about?

"Not so long ago I was looking for a dress. It was gorgeous, but didnt fit me right because of my small breasts  It also had a deep neckline and an open (back?you can see it here:

Invisible bra hasn't helped me because it had a visible front closure! And I thought, why not to make a bra without any closures at all?


I really liked this idea and I decided to bring it to life! I think many of us find this idea very useful, because not everyone has the  money for a plastic surgery. But who needs them anymore? With this bra you will look your best without any effort and it's very easy to use and comfortable!!


How it works?

The structure is made of stainless steel and adapted to every curve of your body! Bra can be filled for those who have small breasts and no filled for those who just want to emphasize the shape of the breasts! The internal coating consists of a thin layer of silicone that will support your breasts! As you can see it's pretty simle! And you will be gorgeous in any attire!

Look at this photo!

Before:

And after:


What we asking about?

Money is needed for the of a place to work,tenancy and equipment.
At the moment we are working on developing an online store for users who want to by them online!

How you can help?

If you can not help financially,please share it whith friends they may be interested in any case thank you very much for your attention!!!

story:
WatchForChange is a purpose-driven brand

 inspired by a simple idea to

    






Our Mission

Our mission is to unite socially conscious people around the world — and, together, inspire positive change for our local and global communities.


                       "It always seems impossible until it's done."

                                               – Nelson Mandela


How it works

Supporting our mission and becoming a Positive Change Maker is simple:

1) Choose from one of our unisex watches & pick your favorite strap(s)

2) Choose your cause 

3) Proudly wear your new WatchForChange

WatchForChange Directs 20% Of All Proceeds To The Cause Of YOUR Choice!


Our Charity Partners

We built WatchForChange on the belief that giving back to our communities matter, locally and globally.

So, we’ve purposefully partnered with select nonprofits that we’ve identified as:

· Well established.

· Trustworthy.

· Positivity Focused.

A proven track history of healthy operations is essential for becoming a WatchForChange partner organization.  We ensure that the organization backs up their stated mission with their actions and embraces transparency in their efforts.  Our goal is to help uplift our local and global communities. Each nonprofit partner shares our vision in spreading positivity into the world through their efforts.

We scoured thousands of awesome nonprofits doing amazing acts of innovation and kindness. Our research led us to four organizations supporting an array of noteworthy causes uplifting millions of people. In addition, while supporting their missions and meeting the above criteria, they also have a track record of high ratings.

charity:water is a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  They are not offering grand solutions and billion dollar schemes, but instead, simple things that work.  Things like freshwater wells, rainwater catchments and sand filters.

Each watch purchase will provide clean drinking water for one person!




Mayan Families works with impoverished Guatemalan populations to eradicate extreme poverty and malnutrition through education, sustainable community development programs and emergency aid. 

Each watch purchase will provide a child with nutritious snacks and hot meals everyday for 2 weeks!



The WatchForChange Approach

A simple process guides the WatchForChange movement:

 

A classic watch is timeless — and often the final piece you need to complete your outfit.

Following months of brainstorming, reviewing sketches by our designers, and conducting focused market research, we’re proud to present the first line of our unisex WatchForChange timepieces.

Our goal was to present a uniquely stylish yet unpretentious design that was so versatile you could wear it at work meetings, on casual Fridays, and a night out with your friends.



·  40 MM 316L Stainless Steel Case

·  20 MM High Quality Nylon Strap

·  Water Resistant up to 3 ATM

·  Hardened Mineral Glass


So, we built a sophisticated watch with the option of having nine different watch straps. In seconds, you can easily change the watch strap and sport an entirely different look. No matter the moment, a WatchForChange watch suits the mood.


                   



“Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for a kindness.”

– Seneca



We believe that people are inherently kind. When provided the opportunity to positively impact the lives of others, they will do so through selfless acts of kindness.

Imagine how the collective power of thousands could effect change for millions around the world.

WatchForChange offers a unique and simple solution to achieve that vision: Encourage compassion and invite others to do the same.

By supporting our mission, you become more than a customer — you’re a Positive Change Maker, uniting with others to support causes and positively impact millions of people around the world!

With WatchForChange, you’re not only gaining a new watch. You’re making a statement about the change you seek in your local and global communities — and your commitment to the cause.


One person can only do so much good on their own.

But when you harness the strength of your network of friends/family, amazing things can happen. Today’s social media landscape makes connecting with and reaching people in your network easier than ever. From Facebook to Twitter to Instagram and more, these channels enable us to reach people active in our lives — and align with causes we care about.

Share Good is our way of asking you, our Positive Change Maker, to tell others about the cause you chose to support and to inspire others to join our efforts! United, we can tap into the power of our network to make real change happen in our communities and around the world.  

facebook.com/WatchForChange

@WeAreWFC

@WatchForChange


Who are we?

WatchForChange was founded by a group of friends wanting to collaborate in our skills and talents. Having found entrepreneurial success in the past, we knew we could focus our efforts to build great businesses — but questioned how meaningful our success would be if we were the only ones impacted. We knew we could do more with our passions. Together, we decided to rally around causes that we cared about, so we can help to make a real difference to those who need it most.

So, a year ago, we connected around an idea to design a stylish watch that we’d feel proud to wear — and could become a symbol that brings people closer together by creating positive change in the world. 

And so, WatchForChange was born.


Pre-Order Today

WatchForChange is currently in launch mode, preparing to share our mission with the world! We’ve already designed the watch, sourced materials, and built the prototypes. All we’re missing is YOU.


In order to reach our ambitious vision, we’re inviting you to join us. 

Our goal is to make high-quality, affordable watches. To do so, we’re asking you to join our cause. Every pre-ordered watch helps to provide the funds for our first production run and will support our non-profit partners.


By choosing to back WatchForChange, you’ll become one of our founding Positive Change Makers.

You’ll not only be one of the first to buy our unique WFC watch, you’ll become a changemaker, joining our mission and helping us spread the word! Together, we can make exponential progress toward creating positive change for millions of people around the world.


Sharing Our Story

Social media will be our primary vehicle to spread the word and invite others to join our mission. By simply following us and joining the conversation, you’ll instantly share the story of the positive impact we can all make to help our communities through WatchForChange.

We invite you to like our Facebook page, Tweet our story, post a pic in your Instagram, or all three! And you can unite our conversations with #WatchForChange and/or #WeAreWFC when you post! 


Join Our Movement

1. Pre-Order Your Watch: Select a perk on the right hand side to start your pre-order. 

2. Create Your Account: Continue onto the next page and enter your shipping information and payment details through Indiegogo’s secure site.

3. Complete Your Order:With your order complete, we’ll make the first contribution to our partner organizations and apply these funds to meet our first production run, bringing our vision to life — and the watch directly to you.


FAQ

Q: When will I receive my first WFC watch?

A: Once we meet our Indiegogo campaign goal, we’ll fulfill all orders within 60 days after the campaign ends. We’ll do everything in our power to deliver your watch as soon as possible — and will keep you posted along the way about our progress!

Q: What are the watch details/specs?

Each watch case measures 40MM made from 316 low carbon stainless steel, water resistant up to 3 ATM. All straps are made from high quality nylon measuring 20MM in width.

Q: Does my WatchForChange watch come with a warranty?

A: Yes. Every watch receives a one-year warranty. We take great care to produce high-quality watches free of defects. However, on the rare chance that your watch arrives with an imperfection, we’ll either repair or replace the watch free of charge to you during the warranty period.

Q: Can I change the battery?

A: Yes. Your watch’s battery has a two-year life span. When you do need to replace the battery, your local watch repair shop should be able to replace the battery for you.


Talk To Us

We'd love to hear from you!

Have more questions that what our FAQ answered for you? We’re here to help! Feel free to email us at info@watchforchange.com, and we’ll promptly help you find the information you need.


Thank You

Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign! We believe that, together, we can make real positive change happen for communities — and we’re excited for the journey.

Remember, we all can make an even bigger impact by inviting our friends and family to join the WatchForChange mission. Whether you want to buy a watch for a loved one or simply connect them to our cause, we encourage you to share our story with others — and why making a difference through WatchForChange matters to you.


Individually, we can create awareness. United, we can effect positive change for millions around the world.


With much Love and Respect,

The WatchForChange Family

WatchForChange
offers a unique and simple solution to achieve that vision: Encourage
compassion and invite others to do the same. 
By supporting our
mission, you become more than a customer — you’re a Positive Change Maker, uniting with
others to support causes and positively impact millions of people around the
world!
With
WatchForChange, you’re not only gaining a new watch. You’re making a statement
about the change you seek in your local and global communities — and your
commitment to the cause.

One person can only do so
much good on their own. 
But when you harness the
strength of your network of friends/family, amazing things can happen. Today’s
social media landscape makes connecting with and reaching people in your
network easier than ever. From Facebook to Twitter to Instagram and more, these
channels enable us to reach people active in our lives — and align with causes
we care about. 
Share Good is our way of
asking you, our Positive Change
Maker, to tell others about the cause you chose to support and to inspire
others to join our efforts! United, we can tap into the power of our network to
make real change happen in our communities and around the world.  facebook.com/WatchForChange
@WeAreWFC@WatchForChange

Who are we?
WatchForChange was founded by a group of friends wanting to collaborate in our skills and talents. Having found entrepreneurial success in the past, we knew we could focus our efforts to build great businesses — but questioned how meaningful our success would be if we were the only ones impacted. We knew we could do more with our passions. Together, we decided to rally around causes that we cared about, so we can help to make a real difference to those who need it most.
So, a year ago, we connected around an idea to design a stylish watch that we’d feel proud to wear — and could become a symbol that brings people closer together by creating positive change in the world. 
And so, WatchForChange was born.

Pre-Order Today
WatchForChange is
currently in launch mode, preparing to share our mission with the world! We’ve
already designed the watch, sourced materials, and built the prototypes. All
we’re missing is YOU.

In order to reach our ambitious
vision, we’re inviting you to join us. 

Our goal is to make high-quality,
affordable watches. To do so, we’re asking you to join our cause. Every
pre-ordered watch helps to provide the funds for our first production run and will support our non-profit partners.

By choosing to back
WatchForChange, you’ll become one of our founding Positive Change Makers. 
You’ll not only be one of the first to buy our unique WFC watch, you’ll
become a changemaker, joining our mission and helping us spread the word!
Together, we can make exponential progress toward creating positive change for
millions of people around the world.

Sharing Our Story
Social media will
be our primary vehicle to spread the word and invite others to join our
mission. By simply following us and joining the conversation, you’ll instantly
share the story of the positive impact we can all make to help our communities
through WatchForChange. 
We invite you to
like our Facebook page, Tweet our story, post a pic in your Instagram, or all
three! And you can unite our conversations with #WatchForChange and/or #WeAreWFC when you post! 

Join Our Movement
1. Pre-Order Your Watch: Select a perk on the right hand side
to start your pre-order. 
2. Create Your Account: Continue onto the next page and enter
your shipping information and payment details through Indiegogo’s secure site.
3. Complete Your Order:With your order complete, we’ll make the first contribution to our
partner organizations and apply these funds to meet our first production run,
bringing our vision to life — and the watch directly to you.


FAQ
Q: When will I receive my first WFC watch?
A: Once we meet our
Indiegogo campaign goal, we’ll fulfill all orders within 60 days after the campaign ends. We’ll do
everything in our power to deliver your watch as soon as possible — and will
keep you posted along the way about our progress!

Q: What are the watch details/specs?
Each watch case measures 40MM made from 316 low carbon stainless steel, water resistant up to 3 ATM. All straps are made from high quality nylon measuring 20MM in width.
Q: Does my WatchForChange watch come with a warranty?
A: Yes. Every
watch receives a one-year warranty. We take great care to produce
high-quality watches free of defects. However, on the rare chance that your
watch arrives with an imperfection, we’ll either repair or replace the watch
free of charge to you during the warranty period.
Q: Can I
change the battery?
A: Yes. Your watch’s
battery has a two-year life span. When you do need to replace the battery, your
local watch repair shop should be able to replace the battery for you.


Talk To Us
We'd love to hear from you!
Have more questions
that what our FAQ answered for you? We’re here to help! Feel free to email us
at info@watchforchange.com, and we’ll promptly help you find the
information you need.

Thank You
Thanks for taking
the time to check out our campaign! We believe that, together, we can make real
positive change happen for communities — and we’re excited for the journey.
Remember, we all
can make an even bigger impact by inviting our friends and family to join the
WatchForChange mission. Whether you want to buy a watch for a loved one or
simply connect them to our cause, we encourage you to share our story with
others — and why making a difference through WatchForChange matters to you.

Individually, we
can create awareness. United, we can effect positive change for millions around
the world.

With much Love and
Respect,
The WatchForChange Family

story:
Why to support this campaign?

We believe that fashion should be affordable to everyone. We believe everyone should be able to wear quality product without paying a premium price. We were frustrated by the traditional retail model, which is dominated by mass-manufacturer and high end brand who charge a premium price, as most of this brands artificially inflate prices and invest heavily in marketing to create an illusion of high quality. At the end of the day, what you are paying for is the label and not the product itself. Given our desire to want the finest quality we are under the impression that we get what we pay for. This is the illusion that the fashion industry has created. We started TAILOR CRAFT CLOTHING to provide high quality apparel directly to consumers at wholesale prices thru our website. Since there is no middle man all our products are shipped directly to our customers at wholesale price.

Our great team have people with backgrounds in fashion and designing. We knew we could do better with our team members and experienced staffs and  by selling directly to the customer  we are able to offer the highest quality apparel at revolutionary prices. Since we do not mass produce, so detailed quality measures are taken to provide highest quality apparels.   

About our iTAG shirts

All our shirts are made from 100% Indian cotton/linen. We give significant attention to all our shirts to ensure you are receiving a product that is exquisite, comfortable, durable and long lasting. These fine quality fabrics have a luxurious hand feel and are climate adaptive which make them suitable to wear all year round. Our iTAG shirts are far superior to any designer label and resonates the quality of the finest shirt makers.


Why Indian Cotton?

India has a 5000 year old tradition of cotton. Nearly 200 years ago it helped spark the industrial revolution in INDIA. Today INDIA is one of the leading supplier and exporter of cotton. Indian cotton fabric are so versatile that when its virtue of soft fine and airy reviled, the demand fueled up. Today all the leading brands around the world use Indian cotton.

Where iTAG shirts are manufactured?

We are proud to say that our shirts are produced in India, which has long been known for its tailoring traditions and handwork. We shared the same vision as the factory that we have partnered with for raw materials. Together our aim is to bring back the prestige associated with the 'Made in India' label by offering one of the finest shirts in the market.

We manufacture our products in a specialized shirt making facility in a small town in INDIA. We hire men and women from neighboring villages who are well trained and have more than a years experience. Our aim is to provide meaningful employment to these men and women so that they can look after their families better. 

Exclusivity

We at Tailor craft clothing produce a limited number of shirts every month.  When we launch these shirts on our website (www.itagfashion.com) , they will be sold exclusively for members, people like you, who really want these shirts. As an early supporter, you will receive 40% discount for lifetime and membership access to the website once we launch. We’ll keep you updated!

Where all the $$$ goes

We’re asking for a minimum of $32900 (USD) which will guarantee the full production itag premium shirt. This covers our web designing and first batch production cost and shipping cost. Additional funds will be committed for new product developments.

About Rewards

itag shirts

Fill your wardrobe with something special. itag shirts are made from premium quality 2-ply 120’s 100% Indian cotton which ensure you the finest quality and feather soft feel every time you wear it. 18 – 20 stitches per inch with this close stitching shirt looks seamlessly elegant. This is achieved with a combination of sophisticated machines, accurate machine settings, special sewing needles and rigorously researched threads and sewing speeds. The result is a shirt that is one of the finest and most durable in the world. Each and every small detail is given to ensure you get the finest piece of craftsmanship.


Leather wallet

This wallets are outsourced from reputed brands from India. This wallet has a sleek and classic look made from genuine leather with multiple card slots and money pockets.


Leather card holder

This card holders are outsourced from reputed brands from India. This card holder has a classic slim line design with multiple pockets, a perfect way to carry your cards.


FAQs

How do I submit measurements?

After completion of this campaign we will follow up with an email to get your details like size, design, shipping address, etc.

Do you ship internationally? What are the charges?

We are offering free international shipping through DHL to ship to India, USA, Canada, Europe and UK. You won’t have to pay anything extra for shipping . If you live outside these regions please contact us at info@itagfashion.com

What if there is an issue in quality of product?

We are so confident with the quality of our shirts that if you find anything wrong with any quality aspect, we will replace the shirt for you at no extra cost.

When is the expected delivery?

As soon as the campaign ends, we will start our production and perks will be dispatched by the end of April 2015

Where can I buy itag products after the campaign ends?

Our products will be available on our website (www.itagfashion.com) that you have helped making it possible. We will offer a 40% discount on itag brand on through our website exclusively for members who have helped fund our project, such as you.

Why can’t I pay through PayPal?

As we have launched this campaign from india, the Reserve Bank of India has limitations with regards to receiving funds through PayPal. More details can be found here: http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526426-International-PayPal-Restrictions

For any other queries or suggestions feel free to contact us at info@itagfashion.com

We will get back to you as soon as possible.

Thank you all for your support 

And a special thanks to my team members

Sunny Sharma (Web Designing and Development)

Ashok Nair (Quality Control and Production Incharge)

Alex Mathew (Designer and Cutting Master)
